filesystem

Class File

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.DiskItem
      • filesystem.File

  • public class File
extends DiskItem
    A class of files.
    Version:
    4.0
    Author:
    Tommy Messelis
    Invariants:
  • Each file must have a valid size.
        isValidSize(getSize())
  • Each file must have a valid type.
        isValidType(getType())

    • Field Summary

      Variable registering the maximum size of any file (in bytes).
      private int size
      Variable registering the size of this file (in bytes).
      private Type type
      Variable referencing the type of this file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • File

        @Raw
public File(java.lang.String name,
                 Type type,
                 int size,
                 boolean writable)
        Initialize a new file with given name, size and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        size - The size of the new file.
        writable - The writability of the new file.
        type - The type of the new file.
        Precondition:
        type is effective
            type != null
        Postcondition:
        The type of this new file is set to the given type.
            new.getType() == type
        Effects:
      • The new file is a disk item with the given name and writability.
            super(name,writable)
      • The new file has the given size
            setSize(size)

      • File

        @Raw
public File(java.lang.String name,
                 Type type)
        Initialize a new writable, empty file with given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new file.
        type - The type of the new file.
        Effect:
        This new file is initialized with the given name and the given type, the new file is empty and writable.
            this(name,type,0,true)

        name - The name of the new file.
        size - The size of the new file.
        writable - The writability of the new file.
        type - The type of the new file.
        Precondition:
        type is effective
            type != null
        Postcondition:
        The type of this new file is set to the given type.
            new.getType() == type
        Effects:
      • The new file is a disk item with the given parent, name and writability.
            super(parent,name,writable)
      • The new file has the given size
            setSize(size)

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        @Raw
public File(Directory parent,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 Type type)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 DiskItemNotWritableException
        Initialize a new writable, empty file with given parent directory and name.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent directory of the new file.
        name - The name of the new file.
        type - The type of the new file.
        Effect:
        This new file is initialized with the given name and the given parent directory, type, the new file is empty and writable.
            this(parent,name,type,0,true)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Return a textual representation of this file.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The name of this file followed by a dot followed by the extension representing the type of this file.
            result.equals(getName()+"."+getType().getExtension())

      • canBeTerminated

        public boolean canBeTerminated()
        Check whether this disk item can be terminated.
        Overrides:
        canBeTerminated in class DiskItem
        Returns:
        True if the disk item is not yet terminated, is writable and it is either a root or its parent directory is writable
            result == !isTerminated() && isWritable() && (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable())
        Note:
        This specification can now be closed.

        Return whether the given type is a valid type for a file.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given type is effective.
            result == (type != null)

        @Raw
 @Model
private void setSize(int size)
        Set the size of this file to the given size.
        Parameters:
        size - The new size for this file.
        Precondition:
        The given size must be legal.
            isValidSize(size)
        Postcondition:
        The given size is registered as the size of this file.
            new.getSize() == size

      • getMaximumSize

        @Basic
 @Immutable
public static int getMaximumSize()
        Return the maximum file size.

      • isValidSize

        public static boolean isValidSize(int size)
        Check whether the given size is a valid size for a file.
        Parameters:
        size - The size to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given size is positive and does not exceed the maximum size.
            result == ((size >= 0) && (size <= getMaximumSize()))

      • enlarge

        public void enlarge(int delta)
             throws DiskItemNotWritableException
        Increases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is increased with the given delta.
            changeSize(delta)
        Throws:
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • shorten

        public void shorten(int delta)
             throws DiskItemNotWritableException
        Decreases the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must be strictly positive.
            delta > 0
        Effect:
        The size of this file is decreased with the given delta.
            changeSize(-delta)
        Throws:
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • changeSize

        @Model
private void changeSize(int delta)
                        throws DiskItemNotWritableException
        Change the size of this file with the given delta.
        Parameters:
        delta - The amount of bytes by which the size of this file must be increased or decreased.
        Precondition:
        The given delta must not be 0
            delta != 0
        Effects:
      • The size of this file is adapted with the given delta.
            setSize(getSize()+delta)
      • The modification time is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        FileNotWritableException(this) - This file is not writable. | ! isWritable()
        DiskItemNotWritableException

      • canHaveAsParentDirectory

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsParentDirectory(Directory directory)
        Check whether this file can have the given directory as its parent directory.
        Overrides:
        canHaveAsParentDirectory in class DiskItem
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory to check.
        Returns:
        If this file is not terminated, and the given directory is effective and not terminated, then true
            if (!this.isTerminated() && directory != null && !directory.isTerminated())
             then result == true
        Note:
        This checker now closes the specification of the inherited checker by specifying the result in all other cases than described at the level of the superclass. In case the disk item is a file, any effective and non-terminated parent directory is allowed.
